issue.title: Rclone mangling UTF-8 filenames (normalisation?)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I recently migrated servers using a backup stored on an encrypted google drive (as the entire thing doesn't fit on the old server). I noticed some programs weren't finding files and rsyncing the files off the old server to the new one resulted in a different file name that was then picked up by the programs. Further to this I noticed the only files this occurred on had accents or dakuten. I'll admit the original filenames are probably _technically wrong_ but rclone needs to be using the actual filename not just what it thinks is better.

I thought it was an issue with crypt remotes but the same thing occurs regardless of whether it's Google Drive or Google Drive via crypt - likely ruling out it being a remote issue and instead being in how rclone handles character encoding.

A basic example of what happens is as follows ([tar of the offending filenames](https://helifreak.club/mangle.tar)):

```
'10 - Polonaise in Ab major Op 53 Héroique.flac'
'10 - Polonaise in Ab major Op 53 Héroique.flac'
```

These two lines will likely render the same in the browser, use a hex editor or similar to see the actual encoding. 

The first file is uploaded to a crypt remote with the correct filename, it is then renamed to have _bak at the end, the file is then downloaded back from the crypt remote, the _bak is then removed. There are now two files there - at least on Arch ls output shows the first line has the ' higher above the e than the second.

Should be affecting under 100 of my files so I can rsync them across but I can't delete anything off the new server before confirming whether the filenames themselves are mangled (requiring a reupload of 8 TiB of data, fun) or if it's just occurring during download.

It's also occurring with the following filenames (and many others) if it helps in diagnosis:

```
04 - Wormlust - Sex Augu, Tólf Stjörnur.flac on ó and ö
07 - Nyiþ - Visni Þitt Hold Svo Betur Megi Hæfa Þeim Hug Sem Það Hýsir.flac on ý
09 - Misþyrming - Ég Byggði Dyr í Eyðimökinni.flac on ö
13 ワンダーランド.flac on ダ and ド
```

I think local filesystem is also ruled out, centOS machine is running ext4, Arch is running ZFS, Arch on WSL is NTFS with its wrapper.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

Tested on rclone v1.35, rclone v1.36, and rclone v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

centOS 7.2 64 bit, Arch 64 bit, Arch 64 bit via WSL

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive via crypt

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone copy test gdE:test
then
rclone copy gdE:test test

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2017/06/10 23:35:06 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "." "gdE:test"]
2017/06/10 23:35:08 INFO  : Encrypted drive 'gdE:test': Modify window is 1ms
2017/06/10 23:35:08 DEBUG : Google drive root 'enc/up8n5n0e7087l8sppbee6fprnk': Reading ""
2017/06/10 23:35:09 DEBUG : Google drive root 'enc/up8n5n0e7087l8sppbee6fprnk': Finished reading ""
2017/06/10 23:35:09 INFO  : Encrypted drive 'gdE:test': Waiting for checks to finish
2017/06/10 23:35:09 INFO  : Encrypted drive 'gdE:test': Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/06/10 23:35:10 INFO  : 10 - Polonaise in Ab major Op 53 Héroique.flac: Copied (new)
2017/06/10 23:35:10 INFO  :
Transferred:     15 Bytes (4 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:        3.4s
2017/06/10 23:35:10 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 5
2017/06/10 23:35:10 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "." "gdE:test"]
```
then
```
2017/06/10 23:36:38 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "gdE:test" "."]
2017/06/10 23:36:40 INFO  : Local file system at /home/helifreak/test: Modify window is 1ms
2017/06/10 23:36:40 DEBUG : Google drive root 'enc/up8n5n0e7087l8sppbee6fprnk': Reading ""
2017/06/10 23:36:40 DEBUG : Google drive root 'enc/up8n5n0e7087l8sppbee6fprnk': Finished reading ""
2017/06/10 23:36:40 INFO  : Local file system at /home/helifreak/test: Waiting for checks to finish
2017/06/10 23:36:40 INFO  : Local file system at /home/helifreak/test: Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/06/10 23:36:40 INFO  : 10 - Polonaise in Ab major Op 53 Héroique.flac: Copied (new)
2017/06/10 23:36:40 INFO  :
Transferred:     15 Bytes (6 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:        2.4s
2017/06/10 23:36:40 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 7
2017/06/10 23:36:40 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "gdE:test" "."]
```

May be related to #1431, #1457, or #1212.

rename.from: Investigate not normalising file names and normalising them in the sync instead
rename.to: Investigate not normalising file names and normalising them in the sync routine instead

issue.title: replace slashes and other special characters in file names

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: I've got a file named "Call Log Export: 01/13/15 - 04/21/15". rclone syncs it successfully but treats slashes as directory separators and creates a long path with data in the file called '15'. Native windows google drive replaces special characters with underscores and creates a file named "Call Log Export_ 01_13_15 - 04_21_15" instead. Somehow I like this approach better.

issue.title: Can't upload file that contains special characters

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
`Version "v1.36-DEV"`

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
`Linux Ubuntu`

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
`Google Drive`

I think it's a bug when upload single file. Passed if upload a directory.

- Upload a directory `test/` to `drive:test2`
```
rclone copy -c -vv /home/ubuntu/test drive:test2
2017/07/02 11:35:14 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-DEV" starting with parameters ["/home/ubuntu/bin/rclone" "copy" "-c" "-vv" "/home/ubuntu/test" "drive:test2"]
2017/07/02 11:35:15 INFO  : Google drive root 'test2': Modify window is 1ms
2017/07/02 11:35:15 INFO  : Google drive root 'test2': Waiting for checks to finish
2017/07/02 11:35:15 INFO  : Google drive root 'test2': Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/07/02 11:35:17 INFO  :    ầềm: Copied (new)
Transferred:   4.451 MBytes (1.165 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:        3.8s
```

- Upload a file: `test/   ầềm` to `drive:test3`
```
rclone copy -c -vvv '/home/ubuntu/test/   ầềm' drive:test3
2017/07/02 11:39:59 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-DEV" starting with parameters ["/home/ubuntu/bin/rclone" "copy" "-c" "-vv" "/home/ubuntu/test/   ầềm" "drive:test3"]
2017/07/02 11:40:00 INFO  : Google drive root 'test3': Modify window is 1ms
2017/07/02 11:40:00 DEBUG :    ầềm: Excluded from sync (and deletion)
2017/07/02 11:40:00 INFO  : Google drive root 'test3': Waiting for checks to finish
2017/07/02 11:40:00 INFO  : Google drive root 'test3': Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/07/02 11:40:00 INFO  : 
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:        1.1s
```
```
rclone ls drive:test3
2017/07/02 11:45:05 ERROR : : error listing: directory not found
2017/07/02 11:45:05 Failed to ls: directory not found
```

body: thanks for the important label! looking forward to this

This is all done now

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.37-149-g4ac9a650/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

issue.title: Win64 : Error with non standard Chars with new versions

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

-řá'ö

Full path : d:/test/-řá'ö

in 1.35 version works with it without problems.

issue.title: Normalize file paths/names.
